title: Bug 7752 - Export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails
description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt')
3. From the main menu, select 'File' > 'Export' and select 'Zip File' to export
4. In the 'Export' dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as 'test.zip'), and begin export to zip file.

Observed Behavior:
Exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file fails. An error message box pops up indicating problems encountered during export, with the detail listing the file of the same name in project 2 as the problem.

Expected Behavior:
Exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file should successfully create the zip file without any error messages.
OB: Exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file fails. An error message box pops up indicating problems encountered during export, with the detail listing the file of the same name in project 2 as the problem.
EB: Exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file should successfully create the zip file without any error messages.
SR:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt')
3. From the main menu, select 'File' > 'Export' and select 'Zip File' to export
4. In the 'Export' dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as 'test.zip'), and begin export to zip file.
